results.title: David
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, BFI, James Carr and Paul Dickson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the harsh reality of life in a coal mining town using documentary and fictional techniques. Made in Ammanford, Wales, the film recounts the life of Daffyd Rhys employed as a caretaker for the local school following a coal mine explosion. The story is related by one of the school’s former pupils and covers Daffyd’s early life in the coal mines, his courtship and marriage, his work as a poet, the death of his son, and his life at the school. Most of the roles are performed by the people of Ammanford resulting in a realistic portrayal of life in the Welsh coal mining community. The film was presented as Wales contribution to the Festival of Britain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: World Wide Pictures, BFI, James Carr and Paul Dickson

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Tom Kelly
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
David is a young actor with Down’s Syndrome, chosen to portray a mentally handicapped adolescent in a Canadian television play. Points out society’s unwillingness to accept potential from those with Down’s. David speaks about his condition to a school class and is shown skating, swimming, jogging and cycling, and interacting with family and friends. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: Religious Film Society and Steve Mason
results.brief_description: David Ellis, a 19 year old physically and mentally handicapped person, shares his relationship to everyday situations. The effect of his disability on family and personal relationships. A strongly religious film.

results.title: Dave's story
results.brief_description: In this short monologue the narrator reveals a crucial moment in his young life - when his high school teacher revealed the secret to happiness. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: Daumier
results.creator_credit: Mary Van Den Heyer and Nico Crama
results.brief_description: Daumier was a ninteenth century eyewitness of England and Europe: the observer of great and small men. This film shows some of his lighographic cartoons and caricatures which relate to the period 1830-1873.

results.title: Daughters of the dust [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: American Playhouse Theatrical Films, WMG, Geechee Girls Production and Julie Dash
results.brief_description: At the turn of the century the Peazant family, a multigenerational community threatened with break-up, gathers for a reunion on an island off the coast of South Carolina, historically a place of entry for the European slave ships and a haven for self-emancipated Africans and indigenous peoples. Structured around the twin narratives of Nana, born into slavery, and that of the Unborn Child, this is a rites-of-passage story invoking Islam, Christianity and West African spiritual customs. It is not narrative-driven in the Western mode but is balletic, operatic, non-linear and based on the African oral tradition of the Griot (story-teller), drawing on the Gullah dialect. Dash was also inspired by the literature of African-American women writers. Cast includes Adisa Anderson, Cora Lee Day, Alva Rogers, Barbara-0 and Trula Hoosier.

results.title: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres
results.creator_credit: Showking Films, Maya Films, Henry Lange, Paul Collet and Harry Kumel
results.brief_description: In the lost space of an opulent Ostend hotel, eerily deserted in the off season, a young but hardly innocent couple on their honeymoon encounter the apparently ageless, sunlight-fearing, lesbian Countess Bathory. Kumel imaginatively balances the erotic malaise and violence of vampire folklore and a European (specifically Belgian) surrealist tradition with thirties Hollywood camp and comic strip tableaux. Perverse sexuality is located in a setting of decadent highlife which seems to immobilise the “victims”. Originally titled “La Rogue aux Levres” (Lips of Blood). Cast includes John Karlen, Delphine Seyrig, Danielle Ouimet and Andrea Rau.
results.title_for_label: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres

results.title: Dating the enemy
results.creator_credit: Total Films, Sue Milliken and Megan Simpson
results.brief_description: Guy Pearce and Claudia Karvan star in this comedy which looks at the battle between the sexes from a new perspective. Brett and Tash fall in love but when a lack of compromise threatens their relationship, the forces of the universe intervene. One day they awake to find themselves prisoners in each other’s bodies. Brett learns that being a woman, particularly Tash, presents its own challenges, while Tash learns more than she had bargained for about the male psyche.

results.title: Dating
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Pat Hunder and Garry Dunstan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Examines dating and focuses on the “first date” for teenagers. Looks at dating from the point of view of girls and boys, and first date etiquette. Also examines how other cultures see their children in relation to dating.

results.creator_credit: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Donovan Miller
